name: Hotel Milano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is what it is. It's directly in the middle of Old San Juan. It's a decent, clean, maintained bed and bathroom. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Don't expect a five star hotel. My girlfriend and I spent very little time there, but it sure was convienant. Also, the continental breakfast was adaquate and the view from the resturant was very nice. We had a room in the front of the hotel overlooking the street. I would highly advise you book a room in the back of the hotel. Granted there may be no windows, but the noise from the street is substantial and continues late into the morning. It was bothersome in the room we stayed in, however, I don't believe it would be a problem in the interior rooms.
reviews.title: It is what it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 2 nights at the Milano pre-cruise. Hotel is in a great location for the designer shops, Polo, Guess, Gant etc, and for touring Old San Juan. Staff at the Hotel friendly and helpful. Continental style breakfast more than adequate. We had a Queen room at the front of the hotel, which was very noisy on the Saturday night as the local youngsters are out enjoying themselves till the early hours. Suggest you pay the Milano a visit, and request a quiet room at the back of the hotel. We intend to go back to San Juan again next year and have no qualms about staying at this fine hotel again.
reviews.title: Great Value Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel (in a rear-full room) for an overnight layover before heading to another island. We got in late after a day of traveling and were very tired, hoping to get some sleep. That did NOT happen!! There was some club or something right next door blasting music (this was a Sunday night, not Fri. or Sat.) until at least 3 am. I can't tell you if it went any later b/c I actually managed to fall asleep finally. The bed and the whole room were quite small - and the bed was the type that if one person moves the other is disturbed. I normally have positive things to say about everywhere I stay b/c I am not very picky...I'm not above a super 8 every now and then...but all I wanted was some good sleep and I did not get it here!!!
reviews.title: Stay if you want NO sleep!
Priced right, great location, friendly service.
reviews.text: The only good thing was the location to popular tourist sites. We were able to walk to El Morro the next morning before catching our flight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I would spend a bit more $$ and stay somewhere else if comfort is a priority. This place might be okay for partiers who would want to be in on that late night noise:)
reviews.title: A real gem
Convenient Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Milano. This is one of the better hotels in Old San Juan because it is close to everything. We went there on our honeymoon. The accommodations were well taken care of. All of the staff was exceptionally nice. Everything was in walking distance which made this the ideal place to be. They were able to book us an excursion to the El Yunque Rain Forest that picked us up and brought us back to the hotel. The tour guide was friendly and knowledgeable. Our room was on the second floor in the front. There was some noise on the weekends but that was expected for being in that part of the district. The pictures of the roof-top restaurant on the hotel's website are "real." What a beautiful view of the harbor! We enjoyed our time there in spite of the little noise we experienced. We recommend this hotel to anyone going to Puerto Rico and staying in San Juan.

reviews.title: a treasure!
reviews.text: This hotel is so lovely! It is small enough to make each guest feel important. Besides the perfect location, in the very heart of historic San Juan, the rooms were clean and restful.The restaurant on the top floor was my favorite place to eat in Puerto Rico! The outside section of the restaurant is covered and spacious and has a great view of the harbor. The food and service were flawless. I remember every meal as an event!

reviews.title: Hotel Milano...a special place
reviews.text: The owner ,Mr. Juan San Emeterio, is an exceptionally gracious host whose intent is to create an elegant and personal experience for each guest.

reviews.title: Decent Hotel, Great location
reviews.text: A perfect location for visiting this charming, exciting, historic town. From the roof top restaurant ....the breeze, the morning sun, watching the cruise ship, to the friendly, helpful staff and the nice rooms, the Hotel Milano was our perfect home in Old Town. We loved getting to know the owner, Juan. We agree with the positive letters posted. We highly recommend this small, intimate hotel. Sue and Jerry Johnson, Seattle, Washington

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005
reviews.text: I was a little nervous about the Hotel Milano after seeing some of the negative reviews, but we had a great experience! The room was just fine- spacious enough, small windows, strong A/C, clean. Basically, it's all about location! You really can't beat it- it's central to everything. A couple of times, we forgot things while sightseeing, and all we had to do was trot back to the hotel, and ten minutes later, we were on the go again! The rooftop restaurant is pretty subpar though- have a drink up there for the view, but don't waste your money on the entrees. really, it's kind of a rip-off. We decided to eat there because we were dead tired- but I definitely would not do so again.
reviews.title: San Juan's Goodwill Ambassador ! !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008
reviews.text: This hotel is aged and the rooms small. The staff is not helpful at all, although the man at the breakfast room (truly a continental breakfast, if you can even call it that and the food is lousy) was nice. Guests are not a priority here - I felt like they just wanted my money. The hotel staff, especially the front desk, is not attentive at all and border on rude. The rooms are dismal and feel like they haven't been changed for 50 years, but not in a good way. You can do better.
reviews.title: Not recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After researching many websites, I choose Hotel Milano based on favorable reviews. All I can say is they were WRONG. The Rooms are in desparate need of remodeling. The carpets are crunchy- as in I don't know whats on them, but wear your slippers. The bed was small (advertised as a queen- closer to a full size) and had a huge lump in the middle that left my husband clinging to the bed all night to keep from rolling out. The worst part though- the all night dance music that started at 10:00pm and finally stopped at 5:00am. Loud enough to shake the bed. On the positive side, the staff was helpful and the location can't be beat. I would not recomend this hotel to anyone wishing for a good nights sleep!
reviews.title: As long as you don't mind not sleeping...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in Hotel Milano as the first stop of my honeymoon. We took a cab from the airport (which is easy because there is a line-up for cab's at the airport and set prices in San Juan, $22 to Hotel Milano.) The person working the front was very nice, the hotel lobby was clean and attractive, and our room was very clean as well.
reviews.title: Perfect location in Old San Juan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've read some review on here saying that it's too loud staying on the front-side of the hotel but I didn't notice an issue. Although if you are a VERY light sleeper and wanted to go to bed early (before midnight) you might notice the the stereo of the odd passing car.
reviews.title: Milano is very pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's location is the best part, not even a block away from a bunch or really good restaurants and bars. Our favourite was El Toro Salao which does mostly tapas.
reviews.title: Good value accommodation for old San Juan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night (on a Thurs) prior to our cruise. The best feature of this hotel is its location right in the heart of Old San Juan. It was within a few blocks walking distance of a great restaurant (The Parrot Club). However, the small size of the hotel means limited service in the event of problems. As we were getting ready for bed about 10pm, we noticed a leak from one of the ceiling tiles directly above the shower. The leak quickly became a steady stream, and the ceiling tile looked like it could give way at any moment, dumping who knows what on our heads in the shower. We contacted the front desk and the clerk on duty came up to examine. He said that the manager would be coming to speak with us about changing rooms, but we never did see the manager. And since it was so late, there was no maintenance person available. There was only one other room available which was smaller than what our cruise stateroom was! So at 11pm, we had to move all of our stuff down the hall to another room, in which we and our luggage barely fit. We were offered a reduction in our room rate. The continental breakfast was average. We were allowed to leave our luggage after checkout while we went on a walking tour of Old San Juan. The luggage was put in the main lobby hallway with a locked chain around it. Not what I was expecting when I had gotten confirmation that our luggage could be put in storage. I would not stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

likes.disliked: — Poor facilities, indifferent service, loud noises

reviews.title: Old world charm in Old Town
reviews.text: We stayed at the Milano for 5 nights prior to a cruise and found it very suitable. The price is very reasonable and the Old Town location is fabulous. And we even walked with all our luggage to the pier! The hotel is small and quaint - very clean and staff offered wonderful, personal hospitality. Our room was small but comfortable and bathroom great! Breakfast on the roof terrace was delightful. Too bad a tall building is being constructed a couple blocks away which will destroy the nice view of the harbor. We read about the Milano in a NY Times travel review. Their web site showed they didn't have availability for the full length of our stay, but a direct call proved that it would be possible after all. It pays to call direct.

reviews.title: Excellent location and staff
reviews.text: Six of us stayed there for 3 nights, January, 2007. The location in the heart of Olde Towne was very convenient. The hotel was well kept and the rooms were of average size and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We enjoyed the rooftop restaurant and the food and service was very good. We were there during the festival of St. Sebastion. Olde Towne was very crowded and the taxis could not come and go as customary, so that was a disadvantage. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us. Everyone from the front desk to the restaurant servers were helpful and friendly. (we could not get a taxi to take us to our cruise line so 2 of their empoyees loaded our luggage on carts and escorted us 5 blocks to our ship.) I hope to visit San Juan in the future and I will definitely stay at Hotel Milano again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 2 days post cruise and had a wonderful time! The location was fantastic in Old San Juan! It was within walking distance of everything! We could have walked from the cruise except uphill with all the luggage. The staff was courteous, the rooms were nice, and they had a small restaurant on the roof which was great! We stayed with 2 other couples and we will stay there again when we return to San Juan!
reviews.title: great location

likes.disliked: — it was very basic and not cheap

reviews.title: nice
reviews.text: My husband, 12 year old son and I just returned from a weeklong trip in PR. In Old San Juan, stayed at the Milano: very convenient, clean, accomodating. The rooftop Panorama is a fun place for breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005
reviews.text: What the Hotel Milano lacks in "luxury" it makes up for in location. I stayed in room 406. Our room was located in the front of the hotel. We rarely heard any noise from the street and considering there are a number of bars and clubs in the area not to mention the port, I was pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Smart Choice
Unexpected pleasure in the heart of Old San Juan
reviews.text: Our television had HBO and a number of other english speaking channels as well as spanish. I didn't take advantage of the free continental breakfast, but the one time I went up to purchase a cafe con leche it was given to me on the house.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005
reviews.text: Our room was clean, our bathroom spacious and we had a refrigerator. If you're the type of traveler who isn't hung up on bells and whistles, I would suggest the Hotel Milano. I know I'll stay there again.
reviews.title: So So Room/Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005
reviews.text: If you want to stay in a small boutique hotel in the heart of Old San Juan, the Hotel Milano is the place for you! We only stayed a day or so before we boarded a cruise (a short taxi ride away), but really loved being able to walk around, come back for a cool rest or drink, go back out, etc. The rooms aren't overly glamorous, but they're definitely fine. We were in an inside room, which I think might be better because of city night noise (bars, etc.). With the tall ceiling and little ventilation window, it didn't seem "inside" at all. The best part is the roof-top restaurant bar. Very relaxed; we would go up there just to sit, or maybe order a drink...or have a whole meal. Whatever we wanted to do was fine with the staff. The whole hotel just has a lot of character, the owner is a fascinating person to talk to, the mini-grand lobby is a wonderful eclectic mix of classic elements, modern art and relaxed Puerto Rico. If this is the kind of place you're looking for, you'll like it.
reviews.title: A Perfect Stay
a hidden delight!
reviews.text: We just returned from a 7-day vacation in Puerto Rico. What a pleasant surprise we experienced! We made the choice to stay in Historical Old San Juan. We found this wonderful small hotel called Hotel Milano right in the middle of the city. The price was right, the rooms were comfortable and very clean, the staff was professional and vey accommodating, the food from their own 5th floor resaurant with harbor views was superior and the bonus was their little surprising specialties that they would make for you.

reviews.title: Location, Location.
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights on our way to Antigua. The reception clerk was helpful. The room was OK. The breakfast was very ordinary. The best thing is the location , right in the heart of Old San Juan. I was last in San Juan in 1967 so I saw a big change.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is sad that you cannot get a beer in a glass, ( some places will not let you drink out of the bottle ) because of a local habit of smashing the glass in your face. On reflection I suppose the plastic cup was the way to go!
reviews.title: Milano Hotel. San Juan's Jewel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a weeks vacation in San Juan Puerto Rico.
reviews.title: Perfect For the price,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Milano is situated in Old San Juan.
reviews.title: Bad back beware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: It is located in Fortaleza Street where most of the Top Restaurants are located (including the Panorama Restaurant in the hotel)
reviews.title: Milano is the best!
Great place in a great place
reviews.text: A wonderful selection, not least because of its location in one of the most happening old neighborhoods in San Juan. No matter your interests, you will find them nearby. Milano itself is wonderfully managed, with very friendly staff, comfortable rooms, and (this was a must when I was there) air conditioning! Definitely a good choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very good stay at the Hotel Milano. The price is the most reasonable we could find anywhere in the old city, and it really is in the heart of old San Juan within easy walking distance of everything. Our room was terrific, the staff was accommodating, the dining room was good, and we would stay there again anytime.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

likes.liked: — Exceeded all others for reasonable lodging at an excellent price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Milano January 4th and 5th 2007 pre cruise.
reviews.title: Exactly what we expected. Location location and location and 2 1/2 star accomi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We choose the Milano because of it's location to the piers and reviews here on Trip Advisor.
reviews.title: Great little hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a double Queen front room for $ 165.00 per night and found the room to be completely satisfactory. Clean, comfy beds and hot water showers.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

likes.disliked: — Room carpet. I'd recommend that the hotel just rip it out and put down tile or marble.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is fantastic! All the 'hottest' restaurants are just down the street - so is the cruise ship terminal - and there is a trolley that stops outside the front door, that will take you all over old San Juan. Our room was spotlessly clean, with comfortable beds, and a little eating nook which overlooked the front street. The staff was friendly and helpful...all in all, we had a great stay at the Milano, and would certainly return the next time we are in San Juan.
reviews.title: We loved the Milano!
little gem but has a noisy problem
reviews.text: we stayed for one night at hotel milano. Great location lovely staff but one big problem...dont stay in the front of the hotel if you want a good nights sleep! We stayed in a lovely room with gorgeous view of old san juan but the noise was so bad neither of us slept......beware the management do not tell you about the noise problem when you book a front room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: It is a lovely hotel and the staff do there best to help when you mention the noise problem, it is the ideal hotel to stay at for visitng old san juan...just be aware if you stay at front of the hotel on a weekend you arent going to sleep!
reviews.title: Clean rooms and friendly service
Great Location in Old San Juan
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Milano. This is definitely not a luxury hotel, but our three rooms were clean and comfortable. They were exactly as described in the email correspondence that I had with the owner. The location is fabulous. It is easy walking to some very nice park areas, the bay, and of course the shops and restaurants of Old San Juan.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The check-in and the overall service were very friendly and efficient. We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant and the food was very good, if not overly memorable. Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu and made good suggestions to please our tastes. The front desk person took the time to give us suggestions about a walking tour that we could do. Our party included two 30 year olds, two 60 year olds, and one 90 year old. His suggestions allowed for all of us to enjoy the stroll with some opting for more virorous routes than others.
reviews.title: Pros and Cons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled on business
reviews.text: This review is long overdue since I visited the lovely Milano Hotel in June. Unfortunately, due to illness I have not been able to write this review sooner. But, it does not diminish the great experience I had while I stayed at the Milano. From the moment that I arrived unexpectedly late one evening (the hotel I was supposed to stay at originally did not have the accommodations it advertised) until I left, the Milano Hotel owner and his lovely staff treated me "as one of their own". My frustration in having to change hotels late in the day was quickly replaced (when I arrived at the Milano) to relief when I was shown to my clean, comfortable and cool room. The desk clerk gave me a warm welcome, the staff were all friendly and helpful, and the restaurant on the top floor was wonderful!
reviews.title: Hospitality at its Best!!!
Home away from Home
reviews.text: The restaurant is a lovely place that affords one a wonderful view of old San Juan and the bay, while also providing great food and great service that can be enjoyed on the outside patio of the restaurant or in the comfort of the air conditioned restaurant area.

reviews.title: A Small, Lovely Place in a Lovely City
reviews.text: Centrally located in old San Juan, with a lovely European-style lobby and personnel with great customer service attitudes make this hotel a wonderful and reasonably priced deal! The room is always clean, and the hotel owner was great to talk to! It was clear to me that the hotel owner is a "hands-on" manager who has high quality standards for his establishment and expects great customer service from his staff.

reviews.title: Clean, affordable rooms. Honest and courteous staff.
reviews.text: Consistency in cleanliness, friendliness and customer service at a reasonable price is what you will find. My gratitude to the hotel owner and his staff for taking such good care of me! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there and recommend it highly.

reviews.title: Perfect Place to stay!!!
reviews.text: Ana León

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Many rooms at the Hotel Milano have NO windows. None, they are like closets. I reserved directly through the hotel and neither their website or any of the communications I had regarding my reservation made any mention that the $155 room I had booked was window-free. I would have never reserved the room and in fact would have paid more for even a sliver of real light. It was really claustrophobic.
reviews.title: Rooms without Windows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Of course by the time I was in, the place was full - as was San Juan - so I had no choice. A sympathetic staff person said it was the policy to only tell people their room would not have a window if they asked. When was the last time you thought to ask: will my room have a window?
reviews.title: Great Staff, Good Location in Old San Juan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other complaints (which I would normally let go, but am willing to list given the hotel's unethical policies regarding giving guests full information about their rooms):
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in Old San Juan

likes.liked: — Good value hotel in central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 1) The advertised wi-fi doesn't always work. Another guest and I couldn't get the system to give our laptops IP addresses to connect.
reviews.title: Decent hotel but nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) Breakfast only lasts until 10am, not uncommon but with a noon check-out time you'd think staff would let guests know the hours, especially given the relatively generous check-out time. I found no hours posted in the room (I did find some lights so I could see in the room...)
reviews.title: Hotel Milano friendly, convenient, perfect location, bargain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel for a good price and great location. My wife and I stayed overnight after our cruise ended in Puerto Rico. The hotel is a short walk from the pier and about a 15 minutes taxi ride to the airport.
reviews.title: great location,price and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff was friendly and courteous and allowed us to leave our luggage in a safe area as we arrived at 10:30am and check-in wasn't till 3:00 pm. This hotel is centrally located in old San Juan making everything within walking distance. There are shops up and down the street if you want to get a taste of the Puerto Rican culture.
reviews.title: Good Value

likes.disliked: — Failure to vacuum the room in five days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We happened to book the last available room for the night and it was in the front or street side of the hotel. I would suggest you book early and get a room in the back. I don't think this is a problem unique to the Hotel Milano as the streets are narrow in old San Juan with lots of vehicle traffic.Also there was a large festival in the town square of Old san Juan during our stay which may have affected he noise factor.
reviews.title: Tranquility and safe!!!
Don't Plan on a Rooftop Party
reviews.text: My wife and walked through the streets at night and felt safe and the locals are very friendly with directions. The breakfast in the morning is adequate and the manager is a very nice fellow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very pleased with the Hotel Milano and if you check prices for other hotels in the area they are very reasonable. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Good Value at Moderate Price

likes.disliked: — No view. The room looked out on the hotel's outer walls.

description: Affordable, nice hotel centrally located within walking distance of Old San Juan's many tourist attractions and the cruise harbor. Visit El Morro, San Cristobal, Museums, Art Galleries or shop at Calle Cristo and Calle Fortaleza where you will find many designer outlet centers and fine jewelry stores. Breakfast is offered in the hotel's penthouse terrace with a view of San Juan roof tops.
